wikitext.*:
'''''mirubhōze''''' is a [[Valarin]] word, meaning "a honey wine".<ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}, p. 38</ref> The form ''mirubhōzē-'' is said to be "the beginning of a longer word".<ref name=WJ>{{WJ|AD1}}, p. 399</ref>

It contains the element ''mirub''/''mirub-'' ("wine").<ref name=PE17/><ref name=WJ/>

==Derivatives==

*[[Quenya]]: ''[[miruvor|miruvórë]]''
*[[Sindarin]]: ''[[miruvor]]''
